title: Maelstrom by Peter Watts
description:
This is the way the world ends:

A nuclear strike on a deep sea vent.  The target was an ancient microbeÃ¢â‚¬â€voracious enough to drive the whole biosphere to extinctionÃ¢â‚¬â€and a handful of amphibious humans called rifters whoÃ¢â‚¬â„¢d inadvertently released it from three billion years of solitary confinement.

The resulting tsunami killed millions.  ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s not as through there was a choice: saving the world excuses almost any degree of collateral damage.

Unless, of course, you miss the target.

Now North AmericaÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s west coast lies in ruins.  Millions of refugees rally around a mythical figure mysteriously risen from the deep sea.  A world already wobbling towards collapse barely notices the spread of one more blight along its shores.  And buried in the seething fast-forward jungle that use to be called Internet, something vast and inhuman reaches out to a woman with empty white eyes and machinery in her chest.  A woman driven by rage, and incubating Armageddon.

Her name is Lenie Clarke.  SheÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s a rifter.  SheÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s not nearly as dead as everyone thinks.

And the whole damn world is collateral damage as far as sheÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s concerned. . . .
